text: Varun Choudhary (born February 6, 1995, in Delhi, India) is an Indian politician serving as the National President of the National Students' Union of India (NSUI), the student wing of the Indian National Congress. He has been involved in student politics and activism, focusing on student rights and social justice. == Early life and background == Varun Choudhary was born on February 6, 1995, in Delhi, India. He started his political career as the youngest elected Secretary in the history of the Delhi University Students' Union (DUSU) in 2012. == Political career == === National Students' Union of India (NSUI) === In 2024, Varun Choudhary was appointed as the National President of NSUI. == Advocacy and movements == Choudhary has been involved in various student movements in India: * In 2024, NSUI protested against the rigging of the NEET exam. He also led protests against statements by BJP MP Anant Kumar Hegde regarding changes to the Indian Constitution. == Recent activities == * In July 2024, Varun Choudhary spoke against alleged diversion tactics related to a fake degree row involving the ABVP. * He led NSUI protests at the NTA office regarding the NEET-UG paper leak case. * He supported AYUSH students' protests. == References == == Other websites == * Varun Choudhary's profile on the official website of the Indian National Congress Category:Indian National Congress politicians Category:1995 births Category:Living people
title: Varun Choudhary
